website_summaries.verdict: The Bond is an easy way to control your ceiling fan with a phone, as well as Amazon Alexa devices or the Google Home. HomeKit users will need to look elsewhere, and you'll need to have access to your fan's current IR or RF remote.
pros: The Bond connects your remote-controlled ceiling fan to Amazon Alexa or the Google Assistant and creates a remote on your mobile phone via the Bond app
cons: The Bond isn't available for HomeKit and you must have the original remote to pair a ceiling fan with the Bond

customer_reviews.title: Really excited about the Bond
customer_reviews.text: So far, so great. I have been excited to integrate my Minka Aire ceiling fan into my current home automation with the Amazon Echo and SmartThings. Finally, no more remotes for me. Just simply, "Alexa, turn on the Fan". Setup was simple, the instructions are great. It was easy to setup following the included setup guide. I can't wait to start integrating custom IR and RF devices. I am hoping to control my Roku TV and Garage Door with the Bond!
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: network problem
customer_reviews.text: I have had this device (bond) since feb. 2018 and it has become my biggest headache on my network. the problem is it drops out continually, many times during the day. it might be said that I have an equipment problem but 1 have 45 active devices including 10 cameras on my network. I have 3 not very active fans on bond. I would like to say that I believe this device has a lot of potential, and I really would like this to work!
customer_reviews.author: olpapa

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised. No HomeKit support
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after speaking with a representative from Bond who verified that after an update in March 2018, it would support HomeKit. March came and went and I contacted customer support and I was told it would definitely be ready by July 2018. Well here we are in December, nearly into 2019, I have yet to see HomeKit support or any information released regarding this feature. It works as advertised but outside the HomeKit ecosystem which is unacceptable for me. The prospect of it supporting HomeKit was the biggest and sole influence for me to purchase it...especially since staff reenforced this promise. Pretty frustrated with the company. Over promising and under delivering. Just communicate with us, Bond!
customer_reviews.author: Tweederhill

customer_reviews.title: WARNING! Unit does not tell you the state of the fans/lights after closing app
customer_reviews.text: I went through all the suggested procedures to make the Bond work. They all failed. I contacted Bond customer service via email no response after three days. Last ditch effort to make the Bond work was with the help of Amazon who was able to connect to the Bond support team via a three way call. The Bond support rep stated "we are having problems with the Bond app holding the status of the fan/light after the app is closed". He suggest that I leave the app open. To me the Bond is useless if I cannot access the state of the fans/lights from a remote location.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Can’t comment on tech support since I haven’t used it. This is a great device. I now have the ability to have Alexa control my gas fireplace. My original fireplace remote is some what confusing and temperamental. This bypasses the remote (once set up) and makes it very easy to use voice commands. I also set it up to control my variable speed ceiling fan.
customer_reviews.author: Carson

customer_reviews.title: Works with my Casablanca fans and A totally blind person using a light detector can set it up!
customer_reviews.text: I'm totally blind. I contacted the maker of the Bomb Home fan controller! They whir able to give me instructions that help me to be able to set up the controller. Granted the instructions whir for a person who could see! But using my light detector I was able to do it being I could detect the changes in the lights on the controller. I was able to configure both of my Casablanca 59XXX fans to the controller. Granted The Safe Exit and Light dimming don't work! But the speed change, power, lights do work along with Reverse. I was also able to enable the Bond Home Skill for Alexa and control my fan by voice. Very cool!
customer_reviews.author: Dr-Phone

customer_reviews.title: Garbage living in the 1900s still
customer_reviews.text: Absolute garbage How hard is it to work on their commands for alexa before selling to the masses... Got this to make my other not so smart devices like TV and lights with a remote.... voice controlled and smarter.... After talking to support after alexa not doing commands for TV and lights. He told me they don't have those commands yet... If u have a fireplace and ceiling fan with remotes and you're satisfied with that this is the device for you
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I have several rooms with ceiling fans/lights wired to a single switch by the cheapskate builder. Over the years I had added remote controls to each that would allow the lights and fan to be switched independently. They’re all different brands - hunter, harbor breeze, Hampton bay, etc. This device easily recognized and controls them all. Had the whole house setup in the bond app within 10 mins. Alexa integration works smoothly. Can tell it to turn fan on/off, set to high medium or low, turn lights on/off. This single device made all of the fans Alexa enabled. Much better than trying to buy switches for each device, which was the plan before finding this.
customer_reviews.author: Firemonkey

customer_reviews.title: Works with Minka Aire Concept II
customer_reviews.text: Thank you BOND!!! I have been looking for and trying different solutions to bring my four Minka Aire Concept IIs into my smart home without much luck. Enter BOND. All 4 fans online and working with Alexa in under 10 minutes. 1 month update: Mostly still happy but lost one star. I notice that I constantly have to open the mobile app before I am able to use with Alexa. I have also had to power cycle bond maybe once a week. The mobile app will not see any devices. Power cycle bond and everything works again. Hopefully updates will be released to fix the issues and allow me to add that star back and not take another one away.
customer_reviews.author: J. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what it says it does.
customer_reviews.text: I am now able to control the lights and fans in three different rooms of my house. I don't know what the range is, but in my 1,600 sqft house I have it in about the middle of the house to one side and it hits all of the rooms. I tried a couple other random remote types; my water fall, and my vacuum, but the water fall didn't work, and I found out that the vacuum is infrared, not radio. I didn't expect either to work, so am not at all disappointed. Great product. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: mtmathena

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I had a mix of old fan remotes and new ones in the house. The ones that were close to 19 years old did not work with this device, but that was an easy fix. I went and picked up some new receiver/remotes from Lowes for $30 bucks and they all synced with the Bond device within minutes. Now that I have it hooked up to Alexa, we can now control all of the lights and fans in the house by voice or the Alexa app. This makes our lives much easier, no more looking for lost remotes. This is a great, economical solution to make your home "smarter" without having to replace your entire ceiling fan or wall switches.
customer_reviews.author: ANS

customer_reviews.title: Works great!  6 fans and a generic outdoor shade!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Bond bridge hoping it would support my outdoor shade even though it wasn't Somfy brand. I also have 6 Hunter fans that I knew it could support. My shade (from a popular outdoor awning company), supported both wifi and bluetooth, but with the former you had to buy their expensive bridge (included Alexa and Google integration) and the latter you had to use their app, no integration with Alexa or Google. So I assumed this was more like a general learning remote and didn't use any proprietary encryption. I was right, it worked perfectly! Had the shade and all 6 fans set up in 15 minutes and integrated with Alexa and Google.
customer_reviews.author: R. Burrowes

customer_reviews.title: Hey Google...Turn on ceiling fan...
customer_reviews.text: I recently replaced two aftermarket ceiling fans in each of my daughter’s rooms and installed one with remotes. They loved it but I felt like I could take it to another level by integrating it into our “Google” smart home. That’s where this little guy came into play. It took no time at all to pair their remote’s functions with the Bond Bridge. Once paired, all I needed to do next was add it to my google home which was seamless. Now google controls the ceiling fan lights, ceiling fan itself and three different fan speeds. We couldn’t be any happier. I definitely recommend to anyone looking to add a bit of convenience to their life.
customer_reviews.author: DT

customer_reviews.title: This is a great item. Was easy to install and has been ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great item. Was easy to install and has been great for the ceiling fan as promised. What has not been as promised is the speed that they add new functions. Fireplaces are now out of beta and they are starting to blinds. Hardly the aggressive roll out initial descriptions lead me to believe. I love the device with my echo and will purchase another once blinds are in use do to the functionality. I went ahead and bought a different device for the garage door as I suspect that is a year or more away. I do recommend the item for fans and fireplaces if that is all you need.
customer_reviews.author: frequent shopper

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what I had hoped
customer_reviews.text: The Bond works exactly as I had hoped, with one small exception: Alexa integration does not allow for dimming of lights. Otherwise, this one device turned all of the fans and their lights in my home (that have remotes) into smart devices. Setup was initially a little bumpy, as I would add a new fan to the hub and it would immediately disappear. So I added it again, and it disappeared. Then upon app restart I had two fans named the same. Minor inconvenience for such a strong product. Very happy with this purchase, and I am hoping for dimming functionality to eventually make it into the Alexa skill.
customer_reviews.author: Richard C Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Not useful
customer_reviews.text: It works, in that it will identify that there is a ceiling fan to control. But that's it. It won't work all the features of the fan. With the Bond, I can turn on the fan and set it to low, but not back to high. I can't set the fan to temperature controlled or random. I can't dim the light. If I tell it to turn off the light, it turns off the entire system, fan too. Then when I turn the light back on, it turns the light and the fan on. This might be ok if you have a very very simple basic fan and light. Otherwise, useless for me. I sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Speedy Geek

customer_reviews.title: Perfect device!
customer_reviews.text: What a GREAT addition to our home. We're using it to control exterior sun shades (by Crown) and interior blackout shades in the bedroom (by Gaposa). Like a learning remote, the Bond device recognized our remote control codes the first time we tried - such an easy set up! Best of all, it works perfectly with Google Assistant. Just say "Close the outside shades" and down they go! Because of the great Google integration, we can now set timers as well, for example, to close the bedroom shades at 7pm every night. It is a great device, well made, great software, great instructions, really just perfect!
customer_reviews.author: J. Majeroni

customer_reviews.title: Eventually Got It To Work
customer_reviews.text: It was hard to get it connected to my network. I was about to give up, when it finally worked. Then I had to add the ceiling fan. It was a pretty long process to figure out which buttons to program with each function, and to get it to lean the buttons. Once I got it set up, it works great. I enabled it on Echo / Alexa and it's even better. I took 2 stars away for installation and programming.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A must for a Smart Home System - Easy and Works with Hubitat Elevation
customer_reviews.text: I use quite a few systems, Google Home - Hubitat Elevation - Smartthings - Hue Bulbs - Sharptools.io But you'd think with all the zwave systems out there they would have a solid zwave switch.. they don't. The manual switches are clunky and don't work well. Enter - Bond. Bond with a Hubitat Elevation integration script, pushing it over to a SharpTools .io panel, is perfect. A few taps and I have high speed or off. And best of all, when the fan is on.. the little fan blades turn on the panel. Super easy, I just wish it covered more sq footage.
customer_reviews.author: Oakweb

customer_reviews.title: Bond Remote fan controller / Awesome
customer_reviews.text: There are others out there but this ones the best so far. Was easy to set up and one thing I didn't know when I bought this is it also can control any IR devices in the same room its in. I have it set up in my office on the second floor of my house. It's controlling 3 ceiling fans and their lights as well as turning on or off the air conditioner in my office which has an IR remote. It can only do on / off control for the AC, but controls fan speeds and light dimming on the ceiling fans. I do all this by voice using Google Home to integrate with Bond.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Works okay without Alexa but integration is poor
customer_reviews.text: A great idea which works well by itself. Sadly, the Alexa Skill developed by the company is, at best, poor. When using a Hampton Bay fan/light fixture, for example, you can turn the light unit on/off but it is a blind toggle and never know if it was on or not. The dimmer function does not work at all thru Alexa. All functions work reasonably well via the original remote as well as the Bond unit, hence, the problem is a poorly developed Alexa skill which is apparently not being fixed or updated. If you're buying this to use with Alex - beware!
customer_reviews.author: raygam

customer_reviews.title: Ceiling fan control
customer_reviews.text: one of my friends told me about the bond smart home. I recently installed new ceiling fans and wanted to be able to control them remotely. Set up was extremely easy and I had zero issues. All of my ceiling fans paired with bond without a hitch ! I can now control my fans and lights from my Alexa app or my amazon echo. The only disappointment I had was the inability to pair with my garage doors. Other than that I love it. If that capability worked as advertised then I would have given it five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Streets82

customer_reviews.title: It just works
customer_reviews.text: I have six Minka Aire celing fans spread across a 2500 square foot home with two stories. First the Minka fans are great. The move a tremendous amount of air efficiently and quiet. The bond now allows me to control all 6 fans from one location. I have it set up on and Ipad, Android phone and Alexa. I have a google home, but have not set it up for that yet. The product is amazing that it controls all fans from the one central hub. I have a second home and will investigate getting one for that home as well. Buy the product and enjoy controlling your fans without having to search for remotes.
customer_reviews.author: Joni

customer_reviews.title: Great solution for easily adding smart technologies to ceiling fans
customer_reviews.text: Considered this and the devices that you wire inline for an individual fan. Choose this one because I had 3 fans, and also because my ceiling fan mount boxes didn't have much room for additional electronics. Use this with my Alexa to control 3 fans in the house. Great I can control the light and the fan separately, and it has all the controls the native fan remote had. Was super-simple to register a fan, and the range is great-in the open living room downstairs, controls the fans upstairs. Had a couple of times now where the Bond Alexa app needed to be reconnected to my bond account, though.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Bruss CO

customer_reviews.title: Works - where nothing else could
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup. Downloaded app, registered, connected to Bond. Bond attached within 30 seconds - then it updated itself. Taught it about the two fans I wanted to connect with in the house (two different rooms). Each one has a dimmable light and 6 speeds - Bond learned them and they worked first time. Attached to Alex - worked first time. This is a great solution when working with slightly (3 years) older tech. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Dalekchap

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: It says this bond will take 3-5 minutes to upgrade and the screen never changes. I can’t even connect it and I ha s 12 Alexa’s in my house. I Don’t understand what the problem is. Please help and I’ll change my review
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Miller

customer_reviews.title: Love remotely controlling my fans
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this a few weeks ago to be able to control my ceiling fans speed and lights through my Google Home setup in my house. I have smart speakers in almost all my rooms and now I can speak in any room to turn on my fan or set speed and it has worked flawlessly every time. The only thing that sometimes bugs me is the status might get out of sync if I by chance use the physical remote to change status of the lights. Overall very satisfied with my purchase and looking forward to the software improving over time.
customer_reviews.author: RyanG

customer_reviews.title: Minutes to install full Alexa Voice Control for my Ceiling Fan
customer_reviews.text: This very simply to install device works as described. It memorizes the current remote control commands from your ceiling fan and turns your old ceiling fan into a wifi enabled device that works with Alexa. After the very short install of pluging this coaster shaped device in to the electric outlet and setting it to learn. You simply point your current ceiling fan remote control and press the power button. It memorizes the commands from your remote control and duplicates them for you when you speak to your Amazon Echo device. It works great and I didn't even need a ladder.
customer_reviews.author: Fred G

customer_reviews.title: Terrible integration with Alexa.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it was the only device of it's kind that I saw which would connect with Alexa. for $100 one would think setup would be easy, but I was unable to get it to play nice with Alexa at all. Returning it and I'm ordering the Meross smart fan controller to see if I have any better luck with that (plus it's half the price.)
customer_reviews.author: Russell

customer_reviews.title: Turn your remote control fan a smart WiFi fan
customer_reviews.text: Bond works great with my harbor breeze ceiling fan. Easy to set up and great phone tech support. This people take pride on their Bond product Works great with Alexa and Echo Dot. Has a phone application that alows you to control you ceiling fan and light remotely from any place in the world. Plus there’s also a routine scheduling for your fan and light for 7 days a week setting up your ceiling fan automatically. The only problem that I encountered is the phone app scheduling your ceiling fan that sometimes it’s not functional. Overall I’m very satisfied. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Richard Classens

customer_reviews.title: AWFUL integration with ceiling fan
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to control my ceiling fan which has a remote that’s “supported” by this product. Setup was easy for sure and at first largely worked great (dimmer functionality was not exposed in Alexa but that didn’t bother me much and I could still control fan speed) However the integration with the ceiling fan just stops working randomly or is severely delayed (ex you make a command through Alexa or the app and it takes 20ish minutes to take effect). Best “tech support” I’ve gotten is telling me to reset and re add integrations. I’ve had the product for less than 2 weeks and this happened three times now
customer_reviews.author: Sean Whipple

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: We have several Echos and Echo Dots. We have a myriad of smart home devices (switches, plugs, light bulbs, AC thermostats, etc). This is by far the easiest smart home device we have configured. We have 4 fans/lights hooked up to Bond, consisting of Harbor Breeze and Honeywell remotes. I saw this product about a year ago, but was hesitant to pull the trigger because I wasn't sure if it would support my fans. I don't know how it was then, but it is really well done now. Kudos to the programmers!
customer_reviews.author: Neil

customer_reviews.title: Only for Fans
customer_reviews.text: Bond is great. Making your dumb fans smart. It will start/stop fans, turn fan lights on/off and even increase and decrease fan speed(by %ages) but that is all about it. I have had this device for more than a year with a promise that other devices will be controlled by it "soon." How "soon" is "soon", I dont know and would not hold my breath for it. Its good for what it does but dont expect more from it.
customer_reviews.author: Bay Area Pakhtun

customer_reviews.title: What’s not to like.
customer_reviews.text: I have 5 ceiling fans. It initially took me a while to get all five fans attached to this device. However, after I figured out a couple off glitches the remaining 4 fans were a breeze to connect. I can now issue a single induction to turn all of my fans on at once. I hope they add the shades next.....well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Dazzem

customer_reviews.title: Works as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: We use it to control six Hunter fans. Not all of them were automatically discovered in the database, but manually programming them worked fine. They are on two floors but the device has no problem reaching them. Every so often, the signal doesn’t work, but trying again usually solves the problem. As others have noted in their reviews, it is not aware of the fan’s state, so if you say to turn it off, and the fan is off, it will turn it on. We haven’t found this to be a major issue.
customer_reviews.author: Niko

customer_reviews.title: Centrally located, I'm assuming it will work with all remote controlled fans in any house!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly with my two remote controlled fans!!! Was hesitant that it would control more than one fan, but it completely works to perfection! It controls both the light and the fan individually! Added my garage door opener, but had to delete it since it did not require a password to open the garage door. When I did add the garage door, I had to say, Echo, turn off or on the garage door for it to open or close. Hoping Bond will soon update the garage door ability real soon. Also note, both of my fans are at least ten years old!
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Love it!  Exactly what I wanted!
customer_reviews.text: This is the component I've been missing in my automation suite. This seamlessly allows me to control all my remote fans without replacing the wall switches. I can control the light, fan speed, reverse, and delay etc. all from my phone and Alexa . I can't wait till they integrate the garage remotes (future). The only small gripe I have is that there is a Noxema blue light on top that illuminates the entire room at night. I like the house dark when I sleep, and this is annoying. I flipped it over, but it seemed hot when I did that. I'm sure I could tape it or cover it with something, but I'm getting used to it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff M.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Bought the bond bridge a few days ago. Despite concerns that it wouldn’t connect to a hidden WIFI network, it does! And stays perfectly connected thus far. Seemless integration with three ceiling fans w/ lights that dim in 3 rooms and 10 circuits of somfy shades. LOVE IT. Mirrored the SOMFY remotes where each shade is a channel and the last channel controls all shades, so i can voice control them independently or together without Google Home routines, but did google home routines for other shade combinations NOT doable via SOMFY remote. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: TPS

customer_reviews.title: Good and seems to be getting better.
customer_reviews.text: It's not perfect, but it's quite close. I think the software may have updated itself a few times since I bought it. We have ceiling fans/lights in our bedroom and three on our patio. We used to lose the bedroom remote in the bedding and have to practically remake the bed to retrieve it. Often, the patio lights would get left on and we wouldn't realize it until we went to bed and the patio lights were illuminating our bedroom. Now, it's no problem. We just tell Alexa to turn off the lights from the comport of our bed.
customer_reviews.author: why can't you just not put a password on all game's

customer_reviews.title: Cool gadget. A little pricy for the functionality as of now
customer_reviews.text: So far I've set up 2 fans in different rooms and the rf signal works between room. Not exact on light control due to my remotes use hold down buttons to dim the light and they're the same buttons used to turn on/off. But it does fan speed correctly and lights toggle on off on both upper and lower lights. Google home works ok but not with dimming and the verbiage has to be worded correctly. It's app also works ok, good be better for dimming. Also integration to smartings was easy as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Handshy

customer_reviews.title: It's just not ready.
customer_reviews.text: This just isn't ready. It's worked a few times but not consistently. Fans turning on and off via the wall switch seem to break the connection permanently. Setup is not user-friendly, fans are not found during setup with function mismatch and buttons not working (which is technically a hard setup). It's close, just not there yet. Update: A new updated app and firmware seem to have made a huge difference in stability in my setup. Now that it is stable and working, I am excited to say it has been really helpful!
customer_reviews.author: onomonapea

customer_reviews.title: Works great except for Alexa integration
customer_reviews.text: The remote works well over long distances, but the integration to Alexa is less than perfect. It seems to loose connections and the light has really never worked as expected. I am hoping for a firmware update that helps, but for now I will continue to use the phone, skipping Alexa at least for the light.
customer_reviews.author: emzacsco

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly suprised!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with the intention of being able to control my Hunter ceiling fans and two propane fireplaces. Setting up the unit was extremely easy and was up and going in under 5 minutes (Iphone app.) First thing I did was add my propane fireplaces. Recognized the remotes and work great. Then I did the ceiling fans all over the house. Worked great. The hub is in the kitchen and reaches all of the ceiling fans upstairs and downstairs. I recommend this to add some automation to your fireplaces and ceiling fans. As someone who has automated many features in the house (locks, lights, garage door, cameras, sprinklers, and more). This was one of the simplest and user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: R. DiDomenico

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great!
customer_reviews.text: I have two bedrooms that use frequency remote controlled ceiling fans and two patio fans. I added each one to this device by using the original remotes in learn mode and it found the rest of the buttons automatically. Then I set them up in Alexa and have them all on routines to turn on or off the lights or verbally control the lights or fans. You can setup names for them and just target the light or the fan individually with verbal commands or routines. Perfect for when you can’t find the remote too.
customer_reviews.author: shannon m riley

customer_reviews.title: I can finally put the fan remote away
customer_reviews.text: I have long been searching for a way to get rid of my Minke-Aire fan’s battery-powered remote. I can never find it when I need it and the battery dies at least once a year. Now, I have put the remote in a drawer and can control the fan and light with Alexa or my iPhone. Setup was simple and it quickly identified my fan remote. The only downsides are that it requires creating an yet another new account with a small company and requires an internet connection to work, as so many other home automation devices in my home. Overall, I am super happy to be free of the battery remote and using Alexa to control the fan.
customer_reviews.author: Felkster

customer_reviews.title: Works with so much.  SMART home complete.
customer_reviews.text: Been looking for something like this for a while. Integrates perfectly with Amazon Echo and has all the frequencies needed to support RF for ceiling fans and fireplaces. I can now say "Alexa, turn on fireplace".... that's pretty cool. Developers are constantly updating and super responsive. Even if the RF device is not directly support "YET" by bond it will soon be and can still be added today because the app doesn't know what the end product is. This is the perfect fit in the smart home to close the gap on the things you thought couldn't be made smart.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Makes my favorite ceiling fan work with Alexa!
customer_reviews.text: I have a favorite ceiling fan in my master bedroom. With BOND I was able to use Alexa to control both the light and fan! Bond quickly learns from emulating your remote. Easy. And I can also use the original remote, no functionality is lost! The Bond app gives FULL ability to replace the remote, while Alexa misses some abilities until both apps mature. While Alexa integration is not perfect, they are constantly working and perfecting the interface. And, controls for more than just ceiling fans are coming in the future. For me, it is well worth the price. With the one BOND unit, I’m able to control all 3 of my “dumb” ceiling fans without modification.
customer_reviews.author: Jim.Moor

customer_reviews.title: Good product, works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I just got the product yesterday, so far so good. I've configured this to work with ceiling fans and motorized shades, and got both integrated with Google home. All works well for now. Haven't figured out scheduling actions yet. The product doesn't seem to have native capabilities for this yet, researching IFTTT for solutions. The one area for improvement I would say is getting more features on to the Bond android application.
customer_reviews.author: Arbee Jr

customer_reviews.title: Made my ceiling fan work with Alexa.  Done!
customer_reviews.text: I don't get why it is so hard to get a ceiling fan remote that works with Z-wave or other smarthome standards. But BOND took care of it. I had this in my cart for a few months, but it finally made its way into my budget and I ordered it. Within minutes of arriving, I had it working and doing exactly as advertised. Alexa now turns the fan on and off low, medium, and high; and turns the light on and off. It made no sense that all my lights were remote except for the ceiling fan. Now that's done. I love it when things work as they say they will.
customer_reviews.author: Ken J. Burkhart

customer_reviews.title: Easily voice control a gas fireplace and fan
customer_reviews.text: I own way too many smart home devices. I am not bragging, it is actually a bit embarrassing at this point. I have automated everything in my house. Except, for six months, I have been searching for a way to automate my gas fireplaces. I have purchased two devices that claimed to solve my problem. Neither product worked. This product was easy to set up, has a crazy range (50+ feet through walls) and it works! I have it controlling my ceiling fans and two gas fireplaces. A simple command of “Alexa turn on my Living Room Fireplace” now produces instant flame. Easy to setup, controls multiple units and integrates perfectly with Alexa.
customer_reviews.author: David Shear

customer_reviews.title: I've been waiting for this, perfect
customer_reviews.text: I have been wanting a Wi-Fi ceiling fan, but are they pricey. I saw this and thought I would give it a try. It's awesome, downloaded the app plugged it in, connected to my wifi, then point the current remote, and presto, Wi-Fi ceiling fan. Now to get Alexa to see it, enable the Bond home skill in the Alex a app, then search for devices, and now you can just ask Alexa to turn on fan, change speed, then on the light. Couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: TW Shep

customer_reviews.title: Great while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: Great while it lasted. Now it's a nice paperweight after last firmware update. Recent update has rendered this thing useless. I've contacted seller and will update review based on response. While it worked it managed to control 3 ceiling fans all with lights. Worked nicely with Alexa as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Kfrost

customer_reviews.title: Restores/Improves Functionality to a Myriad of IR Devices
customer_reviews.text: I found this an amazing device making all my old infrared remote devices work with Alexa! For the price of this one device I was able to connect both my house fans, their lights, an indoor lighting controller and an outdoor lighting control. I liked that it made functional several remote devices that would have otherwise been rendered obsolete. Distance from the device appears to have no effect—my upstairs bedroom fan, downstairs bedroom fan and outdoor light controller all connected right up and work flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Thorne

customer_reviews.title: Makes those dumb fans Smart!
customer_reviews.text: The BOND now controls the 3 ceiling fans in my house that have been excluded from my "smart home" for the past 2 years! The device works as advertised and it only took about 10 minutes to program all 3 fans and light functions with their remotes. The Alexa integration also works reliably, but it will not function directly with your other Smart Home hub devices. The BOND companion mobile app is functional, but could use both visual and UX improvements. It also lists many other IR/RF devices that will be supported soon such as air conditioners and humidifiers, but with no official timelines for support.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff N. in Northern California

customer_reviews.title: It works in a 1650 square foot two story home
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical about this thing penetrating all our walls to control such old rf tech in our two story home. Well I set this up downstairs in our kitchen and I was able to control it with Alexa in our master bedroom upstairs to control most aspects of our ceiling fan. When I say most that is not any fault to The Bond device but it is how our ceiling fan is wired, only the speed control and fan direction was wired to the rf transmitter, the lights were wired on a separate hard switch. I would need to rewire the internals in the fan to achieve ultimate control but so far it works and it works instantly.
customer_reviews.author: Keo P Thorng

customer_reviews.title: Had to do it.
customer_reviews.text: I had to return the original because I received an opened product after paying for new. Long story... Other than the long story with returns it should get 5stars. Trust me buy it and try it out. Not hard to figure out, check website if you get caught up.
customer_reviews.author: chevyrider

customer_reviews.title: Learning remotes is a pain, buy once done it works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I was able to get all 4 ceiling fans connected (although a couple required numerous attempts at learning the original remotes). Once I got the remotes learned, I relocated the unit to my hallway closet where it was integrated with Alexa and has been working perfectly. It handles the distance to the fans without any issue. I am satisfied although I can see the learning piece being a real pain for less tech savvy folks.
customer_reviews.author: W. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service! UPDATE!!!  4/20/18
customer_reviews.text: Out of 5 fans, I got it to work on one. Sometimes on the others it would just turn on the light and the fan would come on, then it would turn the light off, but not the fan, others would do the opposite, the speeds didn't always work and wouldn't even set up on 3 of them. I am happy for those that it works so well on, I guess that's what I get for trying to be THAT lazy. :) **********UPDATE 4/20/18********** This company has excellent customer service. After the above review was left the company reached out to me personally and made things right. Unit works perfectly and now I can truly be THAT lazy!! :)
customer_reviews.author: Cal-Tex

customer_reviews.title: Does fans okay, still cannot turn off Fireplace
customer_reviews.text: Cool that it controls my ceiling fans speed & light level, however it turns on my fireplace and won’t turn it off. Customer support has taken my case and I have performed sample setups with no cure. Their follow up is slow at best and I still cannot turn off my fireplace with this hub.
customer_reviews.author: Shelton R. Shivers

customer_reviews.title: This thing is fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: This is EXACTLY what I wanted. It actually controls two remote fans I have in the house by name, and being able to adjust the fan while laying in bed at night is fantastic. It is worth every penny just for that. Very easy install and works very consistently. The only flaw (not really a flaw just something to remember) is that you have to leave the physical switch on. In the beginning out of habit we would turn off the fan at the switch leaving the room and it didn’t work the next time. Once we broke the habit this is no big deal. Probably my favorite Alexa toy so far....
customer_reviews.author: Preston Family est. 2006Top Contributor: Golf

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT really work with most fan remotes.
customer_reviews.text: We have two fans we wanted to control. Brands Quorum and Casablanca. We were able to add the Quorum, but no luck with the Casablanca. No phone number. The other fans we purchase will also likely also be In the medium $$ range. Apparently, there’s no way to tell in advance whether the fan/remote will work with the Bond *** Be aware that this item sells with a range of prices on Amazon. Unfortunately my husband didn’t comparison shop and paid $30 more for this product it only works in one room. Our mistake is not impacting our score
customer_reviews.author: Merry G.

customer_reviews.title: Item Mulfunction After 8 Months
customer_reviews.text: The device worked great for a few months but since Oct, its performance has been nothing but dismay! It would turn red without warming, when I reset it, it would work for a while but after a few hours, it would go back to the red state. Tried resetting it multiple times to no avail. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Kor

customer_reviews.title: Great concept....
customer_reviews.text: ...but poor execusion, very easy to install but here is the pickle, alexa although found my 2 fans and light I wasnt able to dependably control by using voice, using the alexa app not or the bond app...very spotty at best, hence I have to keep the remote control close...ok wait a minute wasn't that the purpose of buying this thing to start with. I spent countless hours with support that came to the conclusion that they couldn't figure why it was not working. I am returning this thing, hopefully the bond team will iron out the kinks
customer_reviews.author: GiseleS

customer_reviews.title: 3 Fans and Counting
customer_reviews.text: Not a huge house, but I have remote fans in 3 rooms and can voice control through a connected assistant (like Alexa or Google) from one BOND device centrally located in the house. This is great and while the set-up and linking of accounts and programming take some time, the performance so far has been flawless. It is a very cool thing to be able to voice control the fans throughout the house without having to track multiple remotes. highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: P. B. Terry

customer_reviews.title: Excellent attempt - not perfect, but worth it
customer_reviews.text: I use this to control a Fan/Light in my bedroom that doesn't support smart home commands. It actually works. Setup was a bit of a pain but tech support helped out a lot. I had to create a second WiFi SSID just for this unit, but it wasn't too much hassle. My biggest gripe - my electronic fireplace is not compatible and it is literally one of the best selling fireplaces on the market. Hopefully they will update it soon.
customer_reviews.author: Erik C.

customer_reviews.title: I have the BOND connected to my Alexa speakers and they easily get out of sync
customer_reviews.text: I have connected three fans of three different manufacturers and the BOND supports them all. My only complaint is the BOND does not seem to monitor the status of the device only toggles the function. I have the BOND connected to my Alexa speakers and they easily get out of sync. The status may show as light off when the light is actually on so if I ask Alexa to turn off the light it will show an error as the status is already off. To turn the light off you would have to ask for the light to be turned of to toggle the state.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Prothro

customer_reviews.title: Glitchy - Not Worth It
customer_reviews.text: I wanted so badly for this product to work. It will work for maybe 10 minutes at most after being plugged in. It needs to constantly be unplugged and re-plugged in inorder to work. I'd rather use the remote that came with my fan with how irksome this is.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandrabot

customer_reviews.title: just doesn't work sometimes
customer_reviews.text: It was actually pretty easy to install and setup my ceiling fan. It works about 80% of the time and I have had to completely remove my fan from the app and readd it once when it just completely quit working. Last year I purchased a non-smart remote/outlet ( and thought I would give it a try with Bond - I added the devices as fireplaces - using the remote to program on and off and it worked... That saves me a few bucks in having to buy new devices...
customer_reviews.author: Dale Sackrider II

customer_reviews.title: Great idea for a product and it does work
customer_reviews.text: Great idea for a product and it does work. I hooked up two RF ceiling fans to it. It turns the fans on and off and also turns the fan lights on and off. I am not real handy with electric setups, but I did manage. It wasn't real easy, but I made it happen. The Bond has more trouble with fan speed than anything else. Both my fans had remotes that allowed for three different fan speeds. Alexa seems to have some trouble with speed settings like 1, 2, 3. Alexa seems to want % instead of settings like 1, 2, 3. All in all, I like the product, but there are a few growing pains.
customer_reviews.author: Upperdeck

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Waste of Money Pure Crap!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of this item, hoping over time it would have improved, well I was wrong. Shame on me for expecting things to actually work. I had to rest the modem and all of my set devices disappeared. Pure garbage. A great underdeveloped idea at least by the company it’s currently under. I’m so mad at myself for buying this piece of sh.. I won’t even return it. At least I know this is one product that won’t end up in another mislead consumer. Do not buy this you will be greatly disappointed. It’s pure crap!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Smartlab Top Contributor: Watches

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Set Up. Great Future Potential.
customer_reviews.text: Essentially this thing is an IR blaster. It was designed for remote controlled ceiling fans but can technically control anything. It works great with my Harbor Breeze fan and it's actually more reliable than the remote that came with the fan. I also integrated this with Google Home and now I can talk to my fan, but the range of what you can say is annoying (it only knows low and not slow, for example).
customer_reviews.author: Clay

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup. Even works with floor fans.
customer_reviews.text: As a beginner in smart home integration, the first project I wanted was a smart fan since I only have a floor fan and no ceiling fan installed but did not want to spend a lot of money to find out that it was not worth it. The bond bridge was a good price to "test the waters". The setup was simple, it was able to control my floor fan very quickly and links to my smart home beautifully. Having the bond bridge, I can buy a normal "dumb" ceiling fan and save money. I am very happy with the device. I only wish I would have bought it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Jai6476

customer_reviews.title: doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: 14 months after purchase it is dead. I can't get anything but a red ring when trying to power it on. Its been doing this for 6-9 months now, but in the past unplugging and re-plugging it in for a couple days would eventually get it going again. That hasn't worked this time, it's been dead for a couple months now. As someone that works in IT I've been unimpressed with their support just asking me to reboot the device when I try to report problems. I cannot recommend.
customer_reviews.author: G. Gehling

customer_reviews.title: Great way to make existing fans Alexa compatible.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a way to make my existing “dumb” ceiling fans work with Alexa. This little device was the perfect solution. Setup was a snap and I can now turn fans and their lights on and off and control fan speed all with voice commands. My only nitpick is that I cannot say “set fan to medium” or “set fan to two” for my multi-speed fans, one of which has six settings. What I can do is say “set fan to 66%” for medium. I can use voice command to set high or low fan speeds. Otherwise, Bond works as promised.
customer_reviews.author: Keith T.

customer_reviews.title: Love it - this is what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I do love it, this is exactly what I was looking for, well, I thought I was looking for a new remote unit for my fan, you know, take the whole fan apart and put in another receiver so that I could control the light and fan especially when not at home. I found this thing and was cringing at the $99 price. I do think it's a little pricey but worth it at the same time. This does exactly what I wanted. Only thing more that I would like is timer capabilities and also, the app is a little hard to distinguish if something is in the on or off position. Loving it!
customer_reviews.author: Chicago Girl

customer_reviews.title: Automate your celling fans, finally!
customer_reviews.text: Automating my ceiling fans to get rid of the stupid remote controls has been something that has been on my wish list for years, and their not being an easy solution has been the bane of my home automation existence. The Bond has been a godsend. Super easy to set up, robust and Alexa friendly. I can now control my ceiling fans and their lights, independently, via my phone or Alexa. One Bond is able to control all the celling fans in my ~2,000 sqft upstairs.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Smith

customer_reviews.title: Was great, now a pile of junk.
customer_reviews.text: This hardware works well, but the app needs some refinement as well as some android widgets to make it great. March 27, 2018 - The new firmware makes this device useless unless you broadcast your network SSID. It worked fine with the network ssid hidden until this firmware update. I regret buying this. Alos, the still have not enhanced the Android software so it has the same features as the Apple version.
customer_reviews.author: dms1

customer_reviews.title: Great to control one or more RF-remote-capable fans & their lights! More functionality coming...
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a way to smarten up my ceiling fans - when I told a friend I was thinking about replacing the fan in my bedroom with a Homekit-compatible fan, he suggested I check into this. I jumped at it, and it worked great to control the fans both my bedroom and in my guest room! The one thing I'd change is to have a setting in the app to dim or keep off the ring... I stuck the Bond in a closet because it was too bright to have in my bedroom. There are more RF-remote things that it can handle, but the fans and their lights are good enough for me now!
customer_reviews.author: A. Danziger

customer_reviews.title: No garage door control
customer_reviews.text: I bought the bond product one night after watching an infomercial. The video showed the device controlling many devices. My main interest was controlling my garage door. So I bought it. Almost two years later and I still don't have a date on when garage door control will be added, and since then I have come up with several solutions to control my garage door inexpensivly.
customer_reviews.author: Jtfairhope

customer_reviews.title: Buy this device!
customer_reviews.text: A little shaky with setup (problem probably related with updating while installing); contacted support on a Sunday- they replied in less than an hour - Bravo - but unit completed setup on its own about 5 minutes after tech support was contacted. Setting up fans couldn’t be easier, including 2 Hunters in 2 rooms and a Hampton Bay remote. Commands work nearly flawlessly with Alexa. This is a GREAT gadget. Looking forward to more connectable devices
customer_reviews.author: rvilim

customer_reviews.title: Great device for controlling ceiling fans with Alexa and Google Home.
customer_reviews.text: Great device for controlling ceiling fans minus the dimming features that only work through the App not Alexa or Google Home. I never dim the lights so I don't care. This device works flawlessly or 99.999999% of the time. I could not install a switch in my bedroom or office or family room for my fans because 2 were missing the neutral and one was not even switch controlled. This device fixed that for all of them. I can now control them with Alexa. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: HaveSomeCommonSense

customer_reviews.title: Works well with Somfy Shades and Google Home
customer_reviews.text: Used it to enable voice control of 5 ceiling to floor Somfy brand shades in Miami condo. You would need modest tech knowledge to follow easy instructions in setting up app to control your remote enabled shades. Customer support is OUTSTANDING. Available 12 hours, 7 days.
customer_reviews.author: j. Callicott

customer_reviews.title: Very unreliable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this device for controlling 5 ceiling fans through Google home. It was very unreliable and the signal delayed being sent by 2 hours sometimes resulting in lights turning on and off in the middle of the night. It's going back, very unhappy.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Ralston

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, but could be better
customer_reviews.text: I use this item to control four fans (and their attached lights) in my house. It works pretty well, though sometimes the response from my downstairs fan is delayed (the Bond transmitter is upstairs) and sometimes the signal that the Bond transmits is sent for a long enough duration that a fan light will turn off and then back on after I try to turn it off. Other than these small issues, I like this product and think it was worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Alex G

customer_reviews.title: This thing is AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: Ok - although this is a relatively NEW device, it rocks! I have a bunch of HA devices and various automation routines - most of it tied to Smartthings - but the Bond is already my fav. EASY to setup - I had my 3 ceiling fans AND my master bedroom fireplace up and running with it in no time. My wife loves turning on and setting the speed of the fans using her voice. I have it tied to a routine so when I tell Alexa goodnight from my office , it shuts off the ceiling fan in there, and turns ON my MBR LED fireplace and sets the fan to medium. I HIGHLY recommend this ....
customer_reviews.author: Tank

customer_reviews.title: Finally a solution for my ceiling fans
customer_reviews.text: I love my Alexa more than I should... but I was frustrated that I could not get my ceiling fan on board - until the Bond. This was so worth the price. Super easy to set up, and easy to use. NOTE: it has a blue glowing led light ring on the top of the unit. This was VERY bright and kept me up at night, so I reached out to customer support thinking I was giving them future product advice --- but I was wrong! They already thought of that. You can control the brightness of the blue light in the app, or turn if off completely. I was super impressed.
customer_reviews.author: C Tog

customer_reviews.title: Its kinda works I guess
customer_reviews.text: Works somewhat well from their app, but I really bought it for Alexa integration and thats not great, can't figure out how to control fan speed, so it always comes on at medium, similar struggles with the light, can turn it on but struggles to turn it off. My biggest annoyance is the glowing blue light, its on ALL OF THE TIME, wtf! Ended up moving it out of my bedroom and use it in the living room. So I'm going to keep it, but would;nt recommend it and certainly won't buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Dub

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I was excited when I found out this product existed. I had been looking at ways to control my ceiling fans with Alexa, but I did not want to replace my fans. I purchased Bond, but wasn't sure to expect. The ability to get all of my ceiling fans controlled by Alexa for $100 sounded too good to be true. It was easy to set up and has worked great ever since. I am very satisfied with this purchase and highly recommend it if you are looking to get your fans controlled by Alexa.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip G. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product backed by excellent Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product! It works exactly as advertised! Of my 4 ceiling fans it controlled 3 of them right away with no issues. My 1 fan had problems being controlled but one call to their customer service and they were great. Really worked with me to get my fan to work. Best customer service I have had with an electronics company! Works great with my other smart house products at a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Garret Hutchens

customer_reviews.title: BOND works great, allowing me to access all my ceiling fans/lights ...
customer_reviews.text: BOND works great, allowing me to access all my ceiling fans/lights via Alexa. The set up was quick and easy, using the BOND app. The only thing I wish that it would do is to remember the state that the fan/light is currently in. There are times when one has to repeat a command because BOND only remembers the last function that "it" carried out and does not recognize the current state of the fan/light. If the BOND team can add this function it would allow BOND to work within Alexa routines, such as turning fans/lights off/on at certain times... Otherwise, it works as advertised!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: I love the BOND!!
customer_reviews.text: I would've given a 5 star on easy to install, however right out of the box I had to do a hard reset from a constant red ring. I give it a 5 star because it works AWESOME!!! I'm happy as a freaking clam!! Added: Still freaking love it. Had a few hate moments when it wasnt communicating, checked their app, they were having a problem. Rebooted the next morning, has been PERFECT since. Have 2 fans going, setting up the third sooner or later. So happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Aimee

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and program.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and program. Plug it in, download the app, grab your fan remote(s) and in a few minutes you are controlling your fan/light fixture with your smartphone. I have 7 ceiling fan/light fixtures and the Bond only handles 6 (a little disappointed). The app has a feature to schedule activities, (ie: light on at 6pm, off at 9pm or fan on at speed 3 at 12:00pm and off at 4pm), unfortunately it doesn’t work for me. Still using the IFTTT app I have been able to schedule activities. Yes, Bond work with IFTTT.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry Vogt

customer_reviews.title: Good Idea Bad execution
customer_reviews.text: I am making a smart home and when I go to the ceiling fans I was stumped.Then I saw BOND and thought it would solve my problem. WRONG .I am a tech guy and can set most anything up. This was an easy install with 2 hours of frustration and chat with tech support .My Fans are a year old and have new batteries and remotes. NO JOY ,I would get a green light but never could control anything on the fan. Ill use my remote until another solution comes along
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M

customer_reviews.title: Independence is priceless!!
customer_reviews.text: I have paired 2 ceiling fans to my bond and it works great!! This works especially well for my Dad. He has RA and now he can control his overhead light and fan by asking his 'computer' (Alexa) anytime he wants to. He especially loves turning mine in and if. Lol lol Another piece of independence returned to him!! Thank you Bond!! It was super easy to set up and pair. I didn't have any problems at all.
customer_reviews.author: kapablekeri

customer_reviews.title: Super excited
customer_reviews.text: This product fills a void that is caused by the Hampton bay rf remotes. I had it up and running in 3 minutes flat! The Hampton Bay fans are not typically expensive but I do like the funky ones. Only One concern I had was that the devices box was previously opened... not sure it ever got removed or used but had been cut open.. but all worked flawlessly so my concern has been put on the back shelf
customer_reviews.author: BLVD

customer_reviews.title: The opportunities are endless
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this product! Not only was it extremely easy to program my ceiling fan, but I was also able to connect other IR devices in my home to the bond. I have a handicapped bed that rotates throughout the night and I was able to use the bond to manually control all of the functions of the bed with just my voice. I have talked to customer service twice and they were extremely helpful and knowledgeable. I can’t wait to see more upgrades rollout to see what else this device is capable of.
customer_reviews.author: Nikeguru

customer_reviews.title: Works great..within limits or until you make wifi changes
customer_reviews.text: I just wish it had more features. Why can't it learn any remote instead of having a limited database of devices. It should be able to start my car if I use the transmitter to "teach" it my cars code. Update: tried to edit the wifi this device uses to my new network and the app can't find it even though I'm in the bond WiFi network. Really crappy design. Works when it works but I guess mine is a brick if the company doesnt respond to my email.
customer_reviews.author: Big Shasta

customer_reviews.title: unreliable. Can't get it to connect to a new wifi. Very inconsistent instructions all over the web
customer_reviews.text: unreliable, only worked 50% of the time. Dropped offline almost constantly. Got a new server and it simply won't connect. Keeps saying it can't connect to the BOND unit. I walked thru the instructions over and over again. So unbelievable frustrating. I would rather just go back to getting up and turning my fan on or off by hand.
customer_reviews.author: mower1000

customer_reviews.title: Integrated easily with both ceilig fan and Amazon Echo
customer_reviews.text: The Bond iPhone app worked well the first time. Then, the Amazon Echo app recognized the Bond ceiling fan. One issue is that the fan light control only toggles versus On or Off. Thus, when that light was included into my Kitchen light group, it will go off if the others are on and vice versa. But, the fan itself has no separate On or Off control.
customer_reviews.author: P. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Can you say 'Easy' easily?
customer_reviews.text: Talk about easy to install, I have 2 ceiling fans that are on simple remotes I picked up at the hardware store and had no problem getting this up and running in 10 minutes. My only 'issue' is that it is a bit pricey for the simple things I do with it but maybe I can add more later. I just wish it could do IR in remote rooms (not technically possible without some kind of remote)
customer_reviews.author: KevinQ

product_meta.title: BOND | Add Wifi to Ceiling Fan, Fireplace or Somfy shades | Works with Alexa, Google Home | Remote Control with App | Works with iPhone or Android
feature_bullets: CONTROL CEILING FANS, FIREPLACES, AND SOMFY SHADES FROM YOUR SMARTPHONE - BOND turns any remote controlled fan, fireplace or Somfy shades smart in seconds. Activate the fan, control fan speeds, and switch on lights—all from your iPhone, Android phone, tablet, Amazon Echo, or Google Home Assistant. With BOND, you’ll be able to use these smart devices to do whatever your remote control could do.

ALEXA AND GOOGLE-CERTIFIED - This device is certified by Amazon and Google to work with Alexa and the Google Home Assistant. Control your ceiling fan with voice commands. You’ll never need to reach for the light switch or the remote again. Controlling a ceiling fan and fireplace has never been easier!

CONTROL UP TO THIRTY CEILING FANS - A single BOND can control up to thirty ceiling fans from one central location. The BOND can record and transmit RF (radio frequency) as well as IR (infrared) signals, so it will work regardless of what kind of remote you have. The area range is about 2,500 sq. ft. so you’ll be able to control fans in other rooms or on another floor.

NO INSTALLATION NEEDED - Set up is extremely quick and easy. Simply plug in the BOND device, download the app to your phone, point your fan remote at the BOND, and you’re done! All of the functions on your remote—including fan speed, light dimmer settings—can now be controlled via the BOND.

SMART HOME FUNCTIONALITY WITHOUT BREAKING THE BANK - Everybody wants devices and appliances with smart home functionality, but many of these products are extremely expensive. With BOND, you can make your old appliances smart without replacing them. Our software currently supports ceiling fans and electric and gas fireplaces, but updates are on their way for A/C units, garage doors, and motorized shades!
